speaker: References
text: - [[1.04]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_4/i_hate_frasier_crane.html "I Hate Frasier Crane") I Hate Frasier Crane  - [[1.06]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_6/the_crucible.html "The Crucible") The Crucible    * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}      **RETIREMENT IS MURDER**   _Fade in.  Frasier is gazing out the balcony door, drinking sherry.  Martin and Daphne are at the table wit a bunch of files._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes.  Another beautiful Saturday night.  The moon is full,  the city lights are twinkling, lovers steal kisses in the  park...  and here, Chez Crane, my father and his assistant  sit hunched over twenty year-old photographs of a murdered  hooker. [_raises his glass_] Life is a banquet.

speaker: Daphne
text: I enjoy looking at your father's old case.  Just because  you have no plans tonight, don't spoil our harmless fun.  You know, there's nothing we Brits like better than a  grisly murder and a nice hot cup of tea.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, listen Daphne, I got a lot of work to do here, so if  you don't mind...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, excuse me.  I didn't know I was bothering you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry, it's this damn case.  I feel like the answer  to who murdered Helen is right here.  I just can't see it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you're obsessing.  You stare at these grisly pictures  day after day, night after night.  Come on, why don't we go  out and see a movie?

speaker: Martin
text: No, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's go get a pizza.

speaker: Martin
text: Nah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's get tattooed. [_Martin thinks about it, then shakes  his head._] Oh!  This is ridiculous.  It's a beautiful  night and I'm not going to miss it.  I'm going to go out and  take a long walk and I'm not going by myself.

speaker: Martin
text: He likes the rhododendrons on the north side of the park.  _Fade out.    Scene 2 - KACL    Fade in.  Frasier is on the air with Marjorie._

speaker: Marjorie
text: [v.o.] And I just wanted to thank you, Dr. Crane.  Because of  your advice, I've conquered my fear of heights.  I, I took it  slowly, gradually going higher and higher, until here I am,  right now, having lunch at the top of the Space Needle!

speaker: Frasier
text: Marjorie, congratulations.  I am so proud of you.

speaker: Marjorie
text: I mean, when I think of how you... [_she screams loudly_]

speaker: Frasier
text: God, what's wrong?  What happened?

speaker: Marjorie
text: I just looked down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Marjorie, don't do that.  Look at your luncheon  companion, look at your menu, but don't look down.  You're only feeding your fears when you do that.

speaker: Marjorie
text: Maybe I wasn't ready for a window table.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no.  Of course you are, of course you are.  You can  beat this thing.

speaker: Marjorie
text: You're right, I can, Dr. Crane, if I just... [_she screams  again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Do not look down!

speaker: Marjorie
text: No, I didn't.  My check just came.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, Marjorie, we're just about out of time now.  Call me tomorrow, will you?  Well, that's it for today  folks.  Stay tuned for Bob "Bulldog" Briscoe.  This is  Dr. Frasier Crane, KACL 780, talk radio.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I caught the first hour of your show today.  If that chick  whining about sexual harassment called my show, I'd say  "Listen doll, you don't want people snapping your bra,  don't wear one."

speaker: Frasier
text: Brilliant in its simplicity.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_to Roz_] Hey, how's this sound, hardbody: You, me, Sonics,  Nicks, tonight.

speaker: Roz
text: Sorry Bulldog, but I'm already going.  I have season tickets.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, we can still get together afterwards.

speaker: Roz
text: Only if I smash into your car in the parking lot.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Why is it the ones who want it the most put up the biggest  struggle?

speaker: Roz
text: Because, when I do finally give in, I want us to enjoy it  all the more.

speaker: Roz
text: That is, if I'm not too distracted by the fact that every  man on Earth has died. [_stalks off_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Almost had her there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it could have gone either way.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ah, well, with my pull I can get those anytime I want.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, Bulldog, have you met my brother Niles?  Niles,  this is Bulldog Briscoe.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, oh, just the man I want to talk to.  As a sports  expert I'm sure you can tell me why none of the local media  carry the Ivy League squash standings.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_bursts out laughing_] Whoa!  Another one just like you.  Some gypsy put a curse on your family?  Well, I gotta run.  See you later, Miles.

speaker: Niles
text: It's, it's Niles.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Like it matters.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you ready for our boys night out at La Cochan Noir?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  But Niles, I've been wondering:  Would you mind if I  asked Dad to join us?

speaker: Niles
text: Remember the last time we took Dad to a four-star  restaurant?  He had a miserable time.  The restaurant lost  a whole star.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's just I'm trying desperately to come up with some  way to get him out of the house.  He's off on one of his  "Weeping Lotus" binges again.

speaker: Niles
text: We've tried distracting him before.  We've taken him  everywhere from the arboretum to the zen garden.  [_thinks_]  Wait a minute, the zen garden is at the arboretum.  Good  lord, is it possible we've only taken him one place?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_spotting the tickets_] Oh, Niles, Niles, this is it, this  is it.  The basketball game!

speaker: Niles
text: Basketball?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I can get another ticket from the promotional  department.  Oh, this is perfect.  Just imagine how excited  Dad will be to go to a game with his two sons.  My God,  it's the archetypal male bonding ritual!

speaker: Niles
text: Couldn't we just go into the woods, kill something and have  done with it? [_off Frasier's glare_] All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on Niles, look, it'll give you a chance to see the  Tacoma Dome.

speaker: Niles
text: [_as they walk out_] I've already seen it.  They had a home  show there, once.  You know, that's where I got that idea  to stencil a grape arbor on our Wilkes dresser.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm a Teamster compared to you.   **STRANGERS IN A STRANGE LAND**  _Scene 3 - The Tacoma Dome    Fade in.  Niles and Martin are in their seats.  Niles is looking around._

speaker: Salesman
text: Peanuts!  Peanuts here, peanuts!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, the game is that way.

speaker: Niles
text: I know, I'm just calculating our escape routes in case of fire  or urban unrest.  Maris taught me that.

speaker: Martin
text: You love her, don't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes I do.  Why?

speaker: Martin
text: It just helps to know that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are:  one beer, and two glasses of wine.  I'm sure  it's good, Niles, they opened a fresh box when they poured  it.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you guys doin' drinkin' wine at a ball game?  You  should be drinkin' beer.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I only drink beer when I eat German food.  Which is to  say, never.  [to Frasier]  Did you notice where the  facilities are when you were up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Niles, it's just as you feared: communal urinals in the  mens room.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, fine.  What am I supposed to do about my shy kidneys?

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Dad, aren't these great seats, huh?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's the matter with you?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, nothin'.  Let me borrow your pen a minute, will ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: [handing it over]  What for?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I was thinking about that ballistics report and I just  want to make a note so I won't forget it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, the whole idea of coming here tonight was to get your  mind off of the case.  Listen I've done some reading.  It seems  the key for the Sonics is to stop Starts from penetrating  and dumping the ball off for easy baskets.

speaker: Niles
text: Stop Starts?  That sounds funny.  Stop Starts.  Stop Starts,  stopstarts, stopstarts...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, shut up, Niles!

speaker: Martin
text: It makes no sense.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad, it's not my theory, I'm just quoting some  sports writer.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I mean Helen.  She was tall.  She was five feet seven.  Yet the bullet entered on a downward trajectory.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please try to participate.  Ooh, look!  They're  starting the wave!  Ooh, it's coming this way, it's coming  this way!  _The wave comes, Frasier jumps up with it, Martin and Niles don't  move.  Niles is putting on a headset._

speaker: Frasier
text: That was fun, wasn't it?  Oh, look, there's a peanut guy!  [_calling out_]  Peanuts!  _A bag of peanuts is thrown into Niles's lap.  He throws it back and  forth._

speaker: Niles
text: How dare you!  Stop it!  That hooligan is pelting me with  peanuts!  From the look of that tray, he's come prepared.  Stop it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it, that is for me!

speaker: Martin
text: I gotta go make a call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, this isn't about the case, is it?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad, look, you've been working on it for twenty years,  how come you're so obsessed now?

speaker: Martin
text: Look, when Helen was murdered, I made a promise to her mother.  I said that no matter how long it took, I'd find the killer.  Well, I had a call from her last week, and she's an old lady  now, living in a home somewhere and, I don't know, she just  doesn't seem to have a lot longer to go, and it just kind of  lit a fire under me to get this thing solved.  So, I  appreciate your bringing me here, but I gotta make this call.  I'll be back in a couple of minutes.  [_He gets up to go to the  phones._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, Dad.  I understand.

speaker: Fan
text: Boy, the traffic tonight is murder.  [_to Niles_]  Hey pal,  what's the score?

speaker: Niles
text: West Side Story.  _The man and Frasier both look confused, Niles makes a little  "conducting" gesture.  Fade out.    Act 2    Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment    Fade in.  Martin and Daphne are again poring over the "Weeping  Lotus" material._

speaker: Martin
text: You know what's always bugged me?  This picture of the crime  scene.  The way Helen's written "help."  Why would she do  that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I suppose the word "howdy" would have been a bit too  cheery under the circumstances.  [_She goes to the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: But it makes no sense: anybody who could read "help" in the  dirt could also see Helen lying there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Evening, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, listen, thanks again for the ball game.  It was great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God, it was a pleasure, Dad.  I'm only sorry you  couldn't join us for dinner afterwards.  La Cochan Noir  gave us a late seating for a fabulous dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: It was an exquisite meal, marred only by the lack of even  one outstanding cognac on their carte de digestif.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but think of it this way, Niles: what is the one thing  better than an exquisite meal?  An exquisite meal with one  tiny flaw we can pick at all night.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah... quite right.  To impossible standards. [_They clink  glasses._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Dad, any progress on the case?

speaker: Martin
text: Nah, I'm beat.  Sometimes it's better to just get a good  night's sleep and start fresh in the morning.  Good night,  fellas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Night, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't forget: brush your teeth and say your prayers.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughing_] That's what I used to say to you guys when you  were kids, didn't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you didn't.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  I meant to.

speaker: Niles
text: We knew that.  _He leaves.  Daphne comes from the kitchen with a mug of tea.  Frasier sits at the table._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne

speaker: Daphne
text: How was your dinner?

speaker: Niles
text: It was fine, except for one small flaw.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, just the way you like it.  I see you're a bit intrigued  by that yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well it's been a while since I've gone over this.  Who  are these guys?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, just some of the principal players in our little drama.  [_she passes over a photo_] That's Detective Shelby, the vice  cop who found the body.

speaker: Niles
text: Who is this menacing little mono-brow?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that's Robbethai, a logger.  An ex-boyfriend of Helen's.  He used to come down from the mountains every couple of  months and disappear with her.

speaker: Niles
text: If you ask me, he's the murderer.

speaker: Daphne
text: Impossible, he's got an air-tight alibi.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it?

speaker: Daphne
text: He was killing somebody else at the time.  But you have to  admit, this case has it all: sex, greed, jealousy, revenge,  a monkey, hatred, deception...

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, wait, wait...

speaker: Daphne
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: A monkey?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.  This is a snapshot of the murder victim with her pet  monkey, Koko.  He was given to her by another boyfriend,  Clive Brisbane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, why wasn't Brisbane a suspect?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, he was, but several witnesses saw him at the  racetrack at the time of the murder.

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, is that Clive Brisbane the animal trainer?

speaker: Daphne
text: That's right.  Brisbane's Amazing Apes.  They opened in Las  Vegas for Englebert Humperdink.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's easy to forget there was a time when Las Vegas  wasn't the tacky place it is now.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I actually caught Brisbane's act on a trip to Las  Vegas during college.  Those apes were amazing!  One minute,  they'd be staging a living tableaux of George Washington  crossing the Delaware, the next they'd be shooting suction cup  arrows at Brisbane's lovely assistant's derriere.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, there is a way that Brisbane could be the killer,  and still have his horse track alibi hold up.  Daphne,  Niles, I present you with... the killer!  [_He turns around a  photo of a chimpanzee._]

speaker: Daphne
text: A monkey was the trigger man?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just play along with me here.  They're capable of shooting  arrows, why not a gun?

speaker: Daphne
text: But why would Brisbane have her killed?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting up_] Because, because she jilted him for someone else.

speaker: Daphne
text: Robbethai, the logger!

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly!  My God, we've done it!

speaker: Daphne
text: No, you've done it, Dr. Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes!  But you were standing very close by.  Wait a  minute.  Are we saying here that a murder was committed by a  monkey?

speaker: Niles
text: It's not so very farfetched!  It could be Brisbane's  diabolical homage to the Edgar Allan Poe story "Murders in  the Rue Morgue."  It's all about an orangutan who goes  about the rooftops of Paris murdering people.  Wait 'til we  tell Dad his case has finally been solved!  Dad!  Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  Niles, Niles, wait, wait.  It's still just a theory.  Even if we are right, just think how Dad would feel,  knowing we cracked a case he couldn't solve in twenty  years.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear, you're right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait.  It's merely serendipity that I stumbled into this.  Why can't it happen again?  I simply rearrange the photos  in a way that Dad will see the connection.  All right,  we've got Koko, the gun, and Helen.

speaker: Martin
text: What is it?  No, hey, Frasier!  What are you doin' over  there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no, I got these all set out the way I want 'em.  This one goes up...

speaker: Martin
text: I'll be damned.

speaker: Frasier
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Martin
text: Look at that!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I never thought it would just leap out and bite me  like this.  I think I may have solved this pain in the ass  case.

speaker: Niles
text: You have?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, that's wonderful news!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, no.  Don't get too excited.  I mean, this is kind of  farfetched.  I mean, it's a long shot, but, it's  beginning to make sense to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, lay it all out for us.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no guys, please, just give me a little privacy, will ya?  I just gotta do some thinking.

speaker: Niles
text: No problem, Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: I was just going to bed meself.  Night, all.

speaker: Niles
text: [_turning to stare after her_] Goodnight, Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, look at him.  Do you see the sparkle in his eye?  Oh, Frasier, he's like a little kid at Christmas.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez, what happened to my entry wound close-ups?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la!   **USE A MONKEY, GO TO JAIL**  _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment    Fade in.  Daphne is sitting on the couch, Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is Dad home?

speaker: Daphne
text: Nope, I haven't seen him since he knocked me up early this  morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Knocked me up.  Woke me up.  It's an English expression.  What does it mean here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, something else.  You'd definitely be awake for it,  though.  [_He heads for the sherry._]

speaker: Daphne
text: He was headed down to the station house to present his theory.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God, I wish he hadn't done that.  You know, I've been  turning it over in my mind all day.  The more I think about  it, the goofier it sounds.  I mean, a MONKEY.  Let's hope they  didn't laugh him out of the station, be one hell of way to  end a thirty year police career.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, now, now, Dr. Crane, it's not the most outlandish theory  in the world.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, I could have said it was a trained giraffe.  I suppose it killed her by spitting a bullet at her, thus  explaining the downward trajectory.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't suppose we've heard anything from the station house,  huh?

speaker: Daphne
text: Not yet.

speaker: Martin
text: I was afraid of that.  I mean I knew my theory was a bit iffy,  but when I told the guys they looked at me like I'd lost my  mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Geez, they didn't ridicule you, did they?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, they always treat old timers with respect.  They said  "I'll check it out."  Just like I used to when some nutbag'd  come in there with aluminum foil in his hat claiming the  Martians were trying to steal his brain waves.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, Mr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I don't know what I was thinking of.  I've been walking  around all afternoon just trying to figure out how I came  up with such a half-assed theory.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, it wasn't your fault.  I did it.

speaker: Martin
text: You killed her?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  But I did plant that ridiculous idea in your head.  Remember last night when you came in, so upset that I was  rearranging your pictures?  Well, I rearranged them in a  specific way so that you would... come to the same conclusion  I did.

speaker: Martin
text: So you had the idea first?

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't tell you how terrible I feel.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, don't blame yourself.  You might have put the aluminum  foil in my hat, but I walked right into the station wearin'  it.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll get it.

speaker: Frank
text: Hiya, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Frank.  Frasier, Daphne, you remember Frank Hollings  from the precinct?

speaker: Frank
text: Hey Marty, we gotta talk.

speaker: Martin
text: Frank, about that theory of mine...

speaker: Frank
text: I can't for the life of me figure what you were thinking.

speaker: Martin
text: I know, I know.  I just feel so stupid, wasting your time.

speaker: Frank
text: It cost us a whole afternoon, and five detectives' time.  And all we got to show for it is... heh, heh, we got the  bastard!

speaker: Martin
text: I was right?

speaker: Frank
text: Hey, you don't believe me, ask these derelicts.  _He opens the door and a bunch of cops, some in uniform, come in with  beers.  They are all congratulating Martin: "Hey!  Way to go, Marty!"  "Marty, you still got it!  "And it only took you twenty years!"_

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Mr. Crane, I'm so proud of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's amazing, that's wonderful! [_as a man spills beer  on the couch_]  Oh, that's suede!

speaker: Cop
text: So Marty, how did you do it?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, for years, I thought it was Robbethai, the  logger.  And then I thought, well, maybe it was Brisbane the  animal trainer, but I was wrong.

speaker: Frank
text: How did you finally decide that it was Detective Shelby?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I kept lookin' at that picture, and it kept buggin' me,  you know?  Why was she trying to write "help" in the dirt  and then it came to me!   She was trying to write the  killer's name, "Shelby."  Only she must've died before she  finished the "b" and, and somebody must've kicked dirt over  the "s."

speaker: Frank
text: Well, you nailed him all right.  We pulled him in for  interrogation and he cracked like a nut.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm sorry I ever doubted you.  But, then, you yourself  were beginning to wonder if a monkey could really commit a  murder.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I may have momentarily doubted it, but from time to  time I have to be reminded to trust my gift.

speaker: Martin
text: So, did you call the girl's mother yet?

speaker: Frank
text: Nah, we left that for you.  After all, you were the guy who  solved this thing.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, well, actually, I can't take all the credit for it,  right Frasier?  Come on, get over here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Nah, come on, don't be shy.  I'm proud of ya.  You know,  I was a cop for thirty years and it took my son with his  Ph.D. mind to crack this baby.

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course, I was standing next to him at the time.

speaker: Frank
text: So, tell us about it, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I hate to toot my own horn, but, if it will make  Dad happy.  I suppose it was my expertise in human behavior,  combined with a lifelong enthusiasm for the Rwandan lowland  gorilla that first set me thinking about the monkey.

speaker: Frank
text: I'm not sure I'm following you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps I'm going too fast, I'll go slower.  The key was when  I figured out if Brisbane could teach a monkey to impersonate  George Washington, then surely he could teach a monkey to cock  a revolver, sneak up a fire escape, lie in wait for Helen,  pump her full of lead and then make his getaway, perhaps even  still wearing the revolutionary war regalia in order to confuse  any chance witnesses.  In fact, oh and this is way out there,  but geez, maybe you should check to see if there were any local  bank robberies at the time that were committed by a short,  hairy man wearing a powdered wig.

speaker: Martin
text: You think the monkey was the killer?

speaker: Daphne
text: When I said I was standing next to him, I was really most  of the way across the room. [_She leaves._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, wasn't he?

speaker: Martin
text: No, it was Shelby.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who's Shelby?

speaker: Martin
text: He was a vice cop.  He was in love with Helen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, that was my second choice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can I freshen anyone's drink?

speaker: Frank
text: Help me out here, Frasier.  What did you think the monkey's  motive was?  Jealousy?  Or maybe he just did it for the  insurance money.

speaker: Cop
text: Hey, hey, hey.  Do you think we should put a tail on that  monkey?

speaker: Another
text: If that monkey did it, he'll swing for this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, that's all very funny.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, Frasier you can take a joke, can't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose I can, yes.  Oh, wait!  I've got one.  Who do  you suppose the monkey will get to defend him?  Clarence Darrow?

speaker: Frasier
text: The Scopes Monkey trial...  You know, Darwin's theory of  evolution...  It was turned into a Pulitzer Prize-winning  novel, "Inherit the Wind." [_giving up, to a cop_] Is that  gun loaded?
